page.title: 16Sandringham Cricket Club
page.content:
The Cricket Club has the priviledge of playing on one of the most picturesque grounds in the country. High up beside Park House, it looks out over Sandringham Park, which rolls away into the distance.
A good standard of cricket is played in the North-West Norfolk League and over the last few years, the club has enjoyed its fair share of success.
The ground is maintained by the members who can often be seen on summer evenings with mowers, rakes and watering-cans preparing the pitch for the next match
The charming pavilion was opened by King George VI in 1952.
